[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [State Consistency] This validator is called only for UpdateValue behaviour per line 82 of AEDPoSContract_Validation.cs. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Validation Order] This provider is added after MiningPermissionValidationProvider and TimeSlotValidationProvider. If earlier validators pass but LibInformationValidationProvider fails, is there state rollback, or could partial state changes from previous validators persist? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Missing Context] The function receives validationContext but doesn't validate that baseRound and providedRound are from the same term. Can cross-term LIB comparisons cause incorrect validation results? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Timestamp Validation] LIB validation checks heights and round numbers but not timestamps. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Cross-Chain] If this is a side chain, does LIB validation ensure the ConfirmedIrreversibleBlockHeight doesn't exceed the parent chain's indexed height, or can side chains claim LIB heights beyond parent chain knowledge? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Line 14] The condition checks providedRound.ConfirmedIrreversibleBlockHeight != 0. What if ConfirmedIrreversibleBlockHeight is negative? Does C# long allow negative values to pass this check and bypass validation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Line 15] The condition checks providedRound.ConfirmedIrreversibleBlockRoundNumber != 0. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Line 16] Uses strict greater-than (>). If baseRound and providedRound have equal LIB heights but providedRound is stale by other metrics (e.g., older timestamp), does this validation incorrectly pass? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Line 17] Second part of OR checks ConfirmedIrreversibleBlockRoundNumber. Can the round number legitimately decrease in certain consensus scenarios (e.g., term transition), causing false positives? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Line 23] ContainsKey check means non-miner pubkeys bypass validation. If pubkey is of a recently removed miner, can they exploit outdated providedRound data where they still exist? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Line 24] Checks if ImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeight != 0. What if a miner legitimately has ImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeight = 0 during chain initialization? Does this cause validation to skip when it shouldn't? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Line 25] Accesses baseRound.RealTimeMinersInformation[pubkey] without ContainsKey. If baseRound is from an older term where pubkey wasn't a miner, this throws KeyNotFoundException. Is this a DOS vector? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Line 26] The comparison checks if baseRound implied LIB > providedRound implied LIB. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Line 32] Sets Success = true unconditionally after passing checks. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Type Safety] All LIB heights use long type. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Boundary Values] If ConfirmedIrreversibleBlockHeight equals long.MaxValue in baseRound, can providedRound never advance LIB higher, effectively freezing finality? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/LibInformationValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Resource Exhaustion] The function doesn't limit how many times it can be called per block.
